reviews.review: Oynamayan vurduruyodur.

“Still Alive（ED曲）”を初めて聞いたときからこのゲームが気になっていた。
その歌詞から、どんなストーリーなんだろうと購入するまでずっと妄想を膨らませていた。

いざやってみると、謎解きなのにサクサクできる気軽さがあり、アクションがあるのがパズルゲームの堅苦しさを中和している。
ゲームオーバーがないので失敗しても何度でも何度でもやり直せる。

ストーリー考察が楽しく、なんと言ってもステージや世界観の雰囲気がいい。
そして出てくるキャラクターすべてに愛着が持てる…それも機械に。
自分なんかは、何もしてないのに問答無用で破壊されるカメラくんに変な愛着が湧いている。しかも実績にまでされてるのだからさらに哀れ、だがそこがいい。

ストーリーをクリアするだけなら３～４時間でできるし、そのあとのチャレンジモードもやりこみがいがあり、とんでもない攻略法が思いついたりする。パズルとしては異様な自由度がある。
何週目かからは、スーパープレイ動画など見てからやってみても楽しいだろう。とにかく何週やっても面白い。

そして製作者の解説、これがまた良い。自分が何気なく遊んでいたステージ構成への製作者の工夫に感心し、さらにこのゲームを深く味わえる。

あまりにグリグリ動かしてると少し酔うのが難点だけども…

なによりPCのスペックが高くなくてもスムーズにできるのが良かった。ロード時間も短く本当にストレスがない。
どんな人にも強くオススメできるゲーム。

Człowiek generalnie jest sentymentalny. Nie ma osoby, która widząc grę z dzieciństwa nie uśmiechnie się i z gracją nie wypowie znanego nam wszystkim "o jaaaaaa". Podobnie jest z Portalem, jeżeli ktoś nie grał - wstyd. Jeżeli ktoś grał, z pewnością chwali sobie każdą chwilę spędzona z tą grą. Po pierwsze, była oparta na rewelacyjnym silniku Source, dzięki któremu fizyka zachowuje się w grze na prawdę po profesorsku. Mimo tego, że gra ma już 8 lat - wydaje się, że minimalistyczne podejście Valve, zdaje egzamin do tej pory. Smutne ściany laboratorium Aperture Science świetnie współgrają z bijącymi po oczach portalach, które de facto sami tworzymy, a ironiczny głos GLaDOS, towarzyszący nam w trakcie gry, bardziej motywuje niż deprymuje do działania. Must have dla każdej osoby, która mówi o sobie, iż jest graczem.

Geliştirici: Valve
Yayımcı: Valve

Bulmacalar da oldukça zevkli.

¿Que se puede decir de esta Obra de Arte?

- Eres llevado a una cámara de relajación de Aperture Laboratories, observas que hay una radio, un excusado y un cuadernillo sobre una prueba. Una voz extraña te da la bienvenida a Aperture Laboratories, no menciona su nombre pero lo que si sabes es que esa voz es un poco extraña. La historia se va desenvolviendo poco a poco y descubres el oscuro secreto que guarda esa extraña voz...


Gráficos: Se ve que el Motor Source del año 2007 se desempeñaba muy bien en los gráficos, junto a unos buenos efectos de High Dynamic Range, Shaders y su complemento (DirectX9) ofreció una estetíca muy interesante.

Sonido: Se pueden entender claramente las voces y demás, también nos acompaña una banda sonora bastante peculiar y sonidos de ambientación que si ya sabes todo lo que ha ocurrido probablemente te causaran escalofríos...

Jugabilidad: ¿Qué se puede esperar de Valve? Como siempre nos trae su cómoda jugabilidad adaptable en cualquier entorno.

Rejugabilidad: ¿Eres el tipo de persona que le gusta completar todos los desafíos y desbloquear todos los logros? ¡Entonces este juego te encantará, al igual que jugarlo en inglés!

Duración: No es largo, lo complete en 1h 45m y eso que estaba explorando cada Cámara de Prueba, pero aún así me entretuvo bastante, lo seguiré jugando porque aún no desbloqueó todo, les recomiendo decodificar las transmisiones, seguro se pillan una que otra sorpresa.

10/10

Jeder der ein Spiel sucht, in dem man mal ein bisschen gefordert wird, und der nicht alzu schnell aufgibt, dem kann ich dieses Spiel nur empfehlen.
Das Spielprinzip ist einfach man hat ein Gewehr mit man zwei Portale schießen kann und so muss man zunehmend schwerere Level abschließen.
Leider sind in Portal 1 eher die Rätsel im Verdergrund und Story ist so gut wie nicht vorhanden, aber das kann man vom zweitem Teil nicht sagen (der übrigens auch um einiges länger ist).
Da ich Rätselspiele allgemein ziemlich gern habe,  ist das bei mir schon mal ein + Punkt gewessen,
aber mich hat an diesem Spiel auch die Athmosphäre so begeistert, denn sie passt einfach perfekt in die Lage in der man steckt.
Ich kann sagen egal ob man Rätselspiele gerne hat oder nicht dieses Spiel ist sehr gut und hat übrigens einen epischen Endsong (STILL ALIVE) und würde dieses Spiel jedem empfehlen, der jetzt nicht von vornerein sagt diese Art von Spielen kann ich gar nicht ab.

I played this game well after I played Portal 2, but I still found it intriguing to play. It was interesting to go back and see the environments from Portal 2 in their original, clean and intact state. It's moderately fun to play, with none of the puzzles being nearly as complex as it's sequel, but still holding my interest well enough. GLaDOS manages to hold her charm despite her delivery and voice being a bit more stiff (I'll atribute that to all those cores hanging off her).

I have quibbles, though. It's very short, with about 4 hours being the amount of time it took me to get through this with pretty much no replay value. A few of the puzzles glitched out, and I had to restart the game to make solving the puzzle possible. The ending was fairly lackluster, with her defeat coming a bit too easily. I felt very unchallenged by this game when compared to Portal 2. As a stand alone though, it's good. I'm not horribly upset at having paid 2 dollars for 4 hours of entertainment. Any more than that, though, and I would've been miffed. Just play Portal 2, you'll get the jist.

This game is a classic. I knew that, but did not play it untill recently. If you are the same, check it out now! It really is great :)

The whole concept of the shooter like environment, but not actually shooting anything is great. Have your children play this if you don't fancy the violent games. It still looks good all these years later as well, and  the atmosphere due to the voice acting and music is great.

One more thought, play this before Portal 2. The story of the second game really follows from this. Also, the 'rules' of Portal are more simple and logically come first - still great though. Then again, if you did play Portal 2 already, you will still have fun going back to Portal. Portal 2 will give a spoiler for the ending of Portal, but the route towards that ending is great fun.

After hearing so much about this game, I decided to try it out for myself, and I was very impressed. Portal is a very immersive first person puzzle game that has truly created a new standard in the industry. With a fully functional "Portal tunneling device" at your disposal, you can accomplish any challenge you are forced to face. With a very fun storyline as well as dark hidden secrets to uncover, Portal is truly an immersive experience that all people can enjoy.  I reccomend this game to puzzle gamers as well as the general audience of PC gamers as a must have for the computer. Can't wait to begin playing Portal Two!

This game will always be a classic in my eyes. I played it years ago and it still stands amazing today. If you know what to do, it's very easy to beat, but it still gives a quality experience!

Gameplay-9/10
The gameplay is very unique even years after its release. This game runs in 3D as you solve puzzles and platform using the 'Portal Gun' which allows you to form two portals that are linked to each other. Go through one portal, come out the other. Although the concept is simple, they find ways to change how it's used as you progress. You start off using portals normally, then you start using momentum to launch yourself! The game continues to give new uses for the Portal Gun until you reach end game.

Story-8/10
The story is mostly one you have to assume. You wake up and are put through tests by a voice you can hear over intercoms or something. You don't know where you are, who you are, or even why you're there, but the game is set up linear, so you go forward. Although lacking in a 'story', the dialogue more than makes up for any questions you have as GlaDos is hilarious as she bullies you throughout the game. Without spoiling it too much (although at this point who DOESN'T know how this game ends) I consider GlaDos to be a triumph over other characters like her in other games. GlaDos doesn't have much of a 'personality' until the end, but her dialogue is witty and well written in a way that makes you feel she has emotion behind her words.

Enemies-?/10
I'm not really going to rate enemies as the only enemies in this game are adorable little turrets that attempt to shoot you full of holes. Enemies aren't the main point of this game, but rather your environment that could kill you if you mess up. YOU are your own Grim Reaper in this game and YOU are the reason you die 95% of the time.

Sense of Progression-10/10
This game is very linear. It's straighter than a meeting of homophobes. However the game never really feels repetitious. The areas all share similar colors, but the challenges change and thinking it's always the same would be a major blunder on your part. You continue to learn how to use the Portal Gun as well as your own mind and mouse. Although short, I feel like I make progress with every test chamber.

Graphics-9/10
The graphics aren't amazing by any means, but I think Valve was aware of this when they made the game. The test chambers are simple and basic, giving you almost no 'graphics' to question, making them seem amazing. Later in the game when the environments are more colorful it's easy to see why they used this trick, but the graphics are still really good, if a bit dated.

Overall-9/10
This game stands as one of my all time favorite puzzle games. It's short if you know what you're doing (I think I once beat it in an hour), but revisiting it from time to time is always a treat as GlaDos is a welcome voice to me. Is it fast paced? No. Is it action-packed? Not really. Is it good? I would say so. This game took something simple and made it fun. If you have the money, I recommend getting this game as it's worth getting at almost any cost.
